intro: Macroplethus henryi, commonly known as the Henry's macroplethus, is a rare and critically endangered plant species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to habitat destruction and over-collection, its population has drastically declined, making conservation efforts essential for its survival.
